summary: TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1990 DODGE CARAVAN.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE WOULD FAIL TO STOP INTERMITTENTLY WHEN THE BRAKE PEDAL WAS DEPRESSED.  IN ADDITION, THE BRAKE WARNING INDICATOR ILLUMINATED ON THE INSTRUMENT PANEL DURING THE FAILURES.  THE DEALER REPLACED THE BRAKE PUMP AT THE COST OF OVER $400.  SHE CALLED THE MANUFACTURER IN REFERENCE TO NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 90V145000 (SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:FOUNDATION COMPONENTS:DIFFERENTIAL PROPORTIONAL VALVE), BUT WAS DENIED REIMBURSEMENT FOR BEING VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO THE REPRESENTATIVE.  THE VIN WAS UNKNOWN.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 141,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 165,124.

I STARTED NOTICING A SLIGHT GRINDING NOISE 1 WEEK BEFORE THE FAILURE. IT ONLY HAPPENED WHEN IT WAS COLD AND ONLY WHEN TURNING LEFT. I THOUGHT IT COULD BE A BAD U-JOINT. ON THE MORNING OF 2-16-07 8:15 AM I WAS TURNING LEFT AT AN INTERSECTION WHEN THE TRANSMISSION GAVE OUT. IT CHEWED UP ONE OF THE BEARINGS (WHICH A MECHANIC LATER TOLD ME WAS NOTORIOUS FOR GOING OUT) AND DROPPED THEM ALL OVER THE ROAD. I WAS CAUGHT IN THE MIDDLE OF THE INTERSECTION WITH NO WAY TO GO ANYWHERE, BLOCKING TRAFFIC. THIS COULD HAVE RESULTED IN A MAJOR ACCIDENT. I WAS ALSO UNABLE TO LEAVE THE VEHICLE ON THE SIDE OF THE ROAD WHICH HAD AN INCLINE TO IT. THE TRANSMISSION WAS NO LONGER ATTACHED TO THE DRIVETRAIN AND PUTTING THE TRANSMISSION IN PARK HAD NO EFFECT. I HAD TO PUSH THE VEHICLE INTO SOMEONE'S DRIVEWAY AND LEAVE IT THERE WITH A ROCK IN FRONT OF THE WHEEL. I DID HAVE THE EMERGENCY BRAKE ON BUT I WAS NOT GOING TO TOTALLY TRUST IT TO KEEP THE VAN STATIONARY. THIS IS THE SECOND TRANSMISSION THAT HAS BEEN PUT INTO THE VAN. IT IS A 1990 WITH ONLY 87000 ORIGINAL MILES. I AM THE SECOND OWNER AND ONLY PUT 2000-3000 MILES A YEAR ON THIS VAN. THE SECOND TRANSMISSION HAS LESS THAN 25000 MILES ON IT.  *NM

DRIVING IN A HEAVY RAIN STORM PULLED OVER AND STOPPED SAW WHAT LOOKED LIKE STEAM COMING FROM THE MOTOR.  IT WAS DAYLIGHT OUT DID NOT NOTICE THAT HEADLIGHTS DIDN'T WORK JUST THE RUNNING LIGHTS TILL A FEW HOURS LATER.  AFTER HAVING HEATER ON HEADLIGHTS WILL COME ON BUT SMELL WHAT SEEMS LIKE WIRES BURNING AND THE SPEAKER ON THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE MAKES A CACKLING NOISE.  OTHERWISE YOU HAVE TO HOLD THE HIGHBEAM SWITCH TO HAVE HEADLIGHTS ON.*AK
CONSUMER STATES THAT WHEN STARTING THE VEHICLE IT WOULD SMELL LIKE GAS.*AK
THE CONSUMER BELIEVES THE VEHICLE'S SEAT BELTS WERE NOT PROPERLY DESIGNED FOR A PERSON 5'4".  THE DEALER WAS NOTIFIED.  *NLM

I OWN A 1990 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN WITH THE  MOTOR. ONE MORNING ON MY WAY TO WORK THE ACCELERATOR STUCK OPEN. I PULLED OVER TO INVESTIGATE AND REMOVED THE AIR CLEANER COVER AND MAP SENSOR TO SEE WHAT WHY THE THROTTLE WAS STUCK OPEN. I FOUND A SQUARE PIECE OF PLASTIC THAT LOOKS LIKE A LITTLE TABLE WITH A HOLE IN THE TOP. I WANTED TO FIND OUT HOW IT GOT THERE SO I TOOK THE AIR CLEANER OUT AND FOUND THAT IT IS SUPPOSED TO HOLD THE CRANKCASE VENTILATION FILTER IN THE BOTTOM OF THE CANISTER. THE BAD THING ABOUT THIS IS THAT I WAS ON ICY ROADS AND THE ONLY WAY I COULD CONTROL THE VEHICLE WAS TO SHUT THE ENGINE OFF AND COAST INTO A DRIVEWAY. I ALSO REMEMBERED THIS HAPPENING TO THE 1991 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER THAT I USED TO OWN. THESE VEHICLES WERE PURCHASED USED AND THEREFORE, I SUSPECT THAT AT ONE TIME SOMEONE HAS RAN THESE WITHOUT A FILTER IN PLACE. THE BIG QUESTION IS,  OF ALL THESE VANS ON THE ROAD, HOW MANY HAVE BEEN RUN WITHOUT A FILTER. I HAD OWNED EACH OF THESE AT LEAST SIX MONTHS BEFORE THIS HAPPENED. I FEEL THAT ANYTHING IN THE AIRFLOW PATH ON A VEHICLE SHOULD BE SECURED SO THERE IS NO WAY IT CAN BE DRAWN INTO THE ENGINE.  *NLM

I AM THE ORIGINAL OWNER OF THE VEHICLE.  AT 48,000 MILES THE TRANSMISSION FAILED.  IT WAS REPLACED BY THE DEALER, GLENN E. THOMAS DODGE IN SIGNAL HILL.  THEREAFTER, EVERY 15,000 TO 25,000 MILES OR SO, THE TRANSMISSION HAS FAILED, PROBABLY 5 TIMES NOW; THE COMPUTER FOR THE TRANS HAS FAILED TWICE, THE MOTOR COMPUTER FAILED 2 TIMES, THE POWER WINDOWS BROKE OFF THEIR TRACKS, THE SLIDING DOOR JAMMED SHUT AND WOULDN'T ALIGN.      NOW THE PAINT JOB ON MY WHITE 1990 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN (WITH WOOD TRIM) IS PEELING OFF, MOSTLY ON THE ROOF (WHERE IT IS ALMOST COMPLETELY GONE, DOWN TO THE PRIMER, RUSTING THROUGH TO THE ROOF METAL) AND ON THE HOOD AND FRONT QUARTER PANELS.  THE PAINT WAS NOT PROPERLY APPLIED TO THE PRIMER UNDERCOAT OR THE PRIMER WAS NOT PROPERLY APPLIED SO AS TO ADHERE TO THE TOP COLOR COAT.  I HAVE SEEN MANY OTHER CARAVAN'S OF THE SAME MODEL WITH THEIR PAINT COMPLETELY OR PARTIALLY PEELED OFF AS I HAVE DRIVEN AROUND.  IT IS A VERY OBVIOUS DEFECT OF THE PAINT--THERE ARE NO OTHER VEHICLES OUT THERE WITH THIS KIND OF PAINT FLAKING AND PEELING PROBLEM TO THIS EXTENT.  THE PLASTIC COATING ON THE WOOD TRIM IS ALL FLAKING AND PEELING OFF AS WELL.  IT MAKES THE CAR LOOK "SHAGGY!"  WHAT A MESS. THIS CAR REALLY NEEDS A PAINT JOB TO BE PAID FOR BY THE MANUFACTURER.  I HAVE PAID OUT THOUSANDS OF DOLLARS FOR TRANSMISSIONS TO BE REPLACED.  I AM ON A THREE-YEAR WARRANTY WITH DODGE FOR THE TRANSMISSION AND ON MY THIRD TRANSMISSION FAILURE UNDER THAT WARRANTY!   THE OVERDRIVE UNIT IS FULLY DEFECTIVE AND THE COMPANY WILL NOT UNDERTAKE TO FIX IT.  THE CAR WILL FAIL AND THE TRANS WILL JUST SPIN WITHOUT ENGAGING ANY FORWARD GEAR OR IT WILL NOT SHIFT INTO THIRD OR OVERDRIVE.  THE SPEED SENSOR UNIT IS ALSO DEFECTIVE AND FREQUENTLY NEEDS TO BE REPLACED.  WHAT A MESS OF A TRANSMISSION!  I HAVE IT REGULARLY SERVICED AND I DON'T DRIVE IT HARD OR ABUSE THE TRANS.  HELP.
PAINT ON 1990 DODGE CARAVAN IS PEELING OFF.
FUEL RAIL LEAKING WHILE DRIVING, VEHICLE TAKEN TO A REPAIR SHOP. DEALER AND MANUFACTURER NOTIFIED AND INFORMED VEHICLE WAS NOT COVER UNDER THAT RECALL. PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION. TS
TRANSMISSION FAILED.  *YH
FUEL RAIL IS LEAKING OIL ONTO  MOTOR, AND COULD CAUSE AND FIRE. CAUSE UNKNOWN. DEALER NOTIFIED.  *AK
WHILE DRIVING 70 MPH VEHICLE SHIFTED INTO ANOTHER GEAR/ STARTED JERKING, AND LOCKED IN PARK.  PLEASE ADD VIN. *AK

THE METAL TIRE BELTS CAME THRU THE SIDEWALLS, LETTING THE AIR OUT.  TOOK BACK TO GOODYEAR DEALER AND THEY SAID THAT IT WAS UNDERINFLATED.  NOT SO! HAD 3 TIRES ALL FAIL LIKE THIS. DEALER SAID THEY WOULD SELL ME THE REPLACEMENT TIRE, BUT THEY DON'T MAKE THIS TIRE ANYMORE.  WONDER WHY?  ONE TIRE EVEN LOST A SECTION OF THE TREAD, ALA FIRESTONE TIRES.*AK

THE METAL TIRE BELTS CAME THRU THE SIDEWALLS, LETTING THE AIR OUT.  TOOK BACK TO GOODYEAR DEALER AND THEY SAID THAT IT WAS UNDERINFLATED.  NOT SO! HAD 3 TIRES ALL FAIL LIKE THIS. DEALER SAID THEY WOULD SELL ME THE REPLACEMENT TIRE, BUT THEY DON'T MAKE THIS TIRE ANYMORE.  WONDER WHY?  ONE TIRE EVEN LOST A SECTION OF THE TREAD, ALA FIRESTONE TIRES.*AK (DOT NUMBER: MKKA33HR18  TIRESIZE: 195/75/R14)
FRONT END LOCKED UP AFTER SNAP RING BROKE WHILE  CONSUMER WAS DRIVING. CONTACTED DEALER.  *AK
FRONT END LOCKED UP AFTER  SNAP RING IN  VHICLE BROKE. CONTACCTED DEALER. *AK
I KNOW OF 3 OTHER FAMILY'S THAT HAVE THE SAME YR., MAKE & MODEL OF VAN WITH THE SAME TRANSMISSION PROBLEM.  *AK

THIS SEEMS TO BE A REAL PROBLEM AND SOMETHING NEEDS TO BE DONE . I FEEL THAT DODGE SHOULD BE HELD RESPONSIBLE FOR THESE TRANSMISSIONS CONSIDERING THAT THEY KNOW THE ARE BAD . PEOPLE SHOULDNOT HAVE TO GO TO COURT FOR DODGE TO PAY UP.THERE SHOULD BE A NATIONAL RECALL AS THERE ARE SEVERAL REPORTS ON FILE .THE TRANSMISSIONS LOCK-UP WITHOUT WARNING AND CAN BE A MAJOR CAUSE OF AN ACCIDENT. THEN WHAT WILL BE DONE?*AK

FUEL WAS LEAKING FROM THE FUEL RAIL.  DEALER DETERMINED THAT THE O-RINGS FAILED AT THE FUEL RAIL CONNECTIONS ALLOWING FUEL TO LEAK ONTO THE ENGINE.  THIS COULD HAVE RESULTED IN A FIRE.  THIS PROBLEM WAS FOUND ON OTHER CHRYSLER VEHICLES.  REFERENCE NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 98V184000.*AK
STEERING LOCK UP AND PULLED ALL THE TO LEFT AND COULDN'T TURN IT AT ALL.  *AK

VEHICLE WAS IN THE PARKING LOT AND  CONSUMER INSERTED  KEY INSIDE OF VEHICLE, AND  KEY STARTED  VEHICLE FIRST TIME.  NEXT TIME IGNITION SWITCH  HAD PLAY.  SHE CONTACTED  DEALERSHIP BECAUSE KEY COULDN'T COME OUT OF  IGNITION SWITCH.*AKI
CONSUMER  HAD USED JACK THAT CAME EQUIPPED WITH VEHICLE SEVERAL TIMES, AND IT FAILED AND COLLAPSED WHILE CONSUMER WAS USING IT. *AK
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK

THE FIRESTONE TIRE PROBLEM SEEMS TO BE HAPPENING TO MY TIRES.  HAD ONE TIRE LOOSE TREAD LAST YEAR AND NOW ANOTHER TIRE IS STARTING TO DO THE SAME THING.  THE STEEL WIRE OF THE BELT IS COMING THRU THE SIDE WALL.*AK (TIRESIZE: 195/75/14)( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: 195/75/14 )

MY 3.0 L 4-SPEED AUTOMATIC 1990 DODGE CARAVAN RECENTLY BEGAN HAVING TROUBLE SHIFTING INTO OVERDRIVE.  IT SHIFTS INTO 1ST, 2ND, THEN 3RD, BUT AS IT TRYS TO SHIFT INTO OVERDRIVE IT BUCKS THREE TIMES THAN ABRUPTLY SHIFTS INTO SECOND GEAR SURGING THE PASSANGERS FORWARD.  I MUST THEN SHUT OFF THE VAN AND RESTART IT FOR IT TO BE DRIVABLE.  I NORMALLY DON'T TAKE THIS TYPE OF ACTION BUT THROUGH MY RESEARCH HAVE FOUND NUMEROUS OTHER SIMILAR COMPLAINTS ON THIS VEHICLE'S TRANSMISSION.  WHEN I FOUND AN ARTICLE IN CONSUMER REPORTS (OCTOBER 1999) WHERE THIS SAME THING HAPPENED TO ANOTHER INDIVIDUAL I DECIDED TO TAKE ACTION.
A METAL FUEL LINE LOCATED NEAR  EXHAUST SYETEM COULD LEAD TO A POSSIBLE FIRE. DEALER NOTIFED. PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER DETAILS.  *AK
PAINT PEELED OFF ALSO. NO SAFETY DEFECT LISTED IN SUMMARY.  *AK
DRIVER SEAT BELT DOES NOT EXTEND FROM THE RETRACTING MECHANISM, CAUSING THE SEAT BELT TO BECOME INOPERABLE.  PLEASE GIVE ANY FURTHER DETAILS.  *AK

THE BOLT THAT ATTACHES THE STRUT TO THE BODY OF THE LIFTGATE PUSHED INTO THE BODY OF THE VAN, CAUSING THE LIFTGATE TO DROP DOWN ONTO VICTIM'S HEAD.  MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT THE PROBLEM. THE PROBLEM HAS NOT BEEN CORRECTED. PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.  *AK
ATTEMPTED TO GET DEFECTIVE PAINT REPLACED BY CHRYSLER CORP, WORKED THROUGH SERVICE MANAGER AT LOCAL DEALERSHIP WITHOUT SATISFACTION. NO SAFETY DEFECT LISTED WITHIN SUMMARY.  *AK

AFTER DRIVING  AND WHEN LETTING PASSENGER OUT OF VEHICLE THE SIDE SLIDING DOOR FELL COMPETELY OFF, MAKING IT MPOSSIBLE TO DRIVE WITHOUT A SLIDING DOOR . CONSUMER TOOK VAN TO PRIVATE MECHANIC TO HAVE IT REPAIRED AT HIS OWN EXPENSE, FEARS THAT IT MAY HAPPEN AGAIN.  *AK *ML
STRUT MOUNT BROKE OFF FROM LEFT SIDE.   CONSUMER  WAS  INFORMED BY AN  INDEPENDENT REPAIR SHOP THAT  STRUT MOUNT ON RIGHT SIDE ALSO  NEEDS REPLACEMENT. DEALER NOTIFIED.  *AK
WHILE DRIVING ABS BRAKE LIGHT CAME ON.  WHEN COMING TO A STOP HIT BRAKES, AND  ABS LIGHT WENT OFF.  BUT, THEN PRESSING ON  BRAKES AND LIGHT CAME ON, AND STAYED ON.  *AK
BOLT THAT SUPPORTS  LIFTGATE FAILED, AND THE LIFTGATE FELL ON CONSUMER'S WIFE'S BACK WITHOUT ANY WARNING OF DEFECT.  *AK

SEE YOUR SERVICE BULLETIN 094 FOR 1990 DODGE CARAVAN CV W/ 3.3 OVERHEATING. THIS HAPPENED IN THE MOUNTAINS BEFORE A STEEP GRADE TWICE! YOU LOSE ENGINE, BRAKES, AND STEERING AS A RESULT. SOMEONE WILL BE KILLED; RADIATORS NOT SUFFICIENT IN THESE MINIVANS AND AS MINIVAN FLEETS AGE THE PROBLEM CAN ONLY GET WORSE... WE DON'T OWN IT ANYMORE; IT'S UNSAFE!  *AK

WHILE DRIVING ON BUSY CITY STREET   VEHICLE BEHIND CONSUMER'S WAS SWERVING AND BLOWING HORN TO GET CONSUMER'S  ATTENTION.  PULLED OVER AND REALIZED THAT THE SPARE TIRE CABLE BROKE, CAUSING THE SPARE TIRE TO FLY ACROSS THE HIGWAY. CONTACTED THE DEALER AND MANUFACTURER, THEY WERE NOT ABLE TO HELP, OUT OF WARRANTY.  *AK
POSSIBLE TRANSMISSION FAILURE IS CAUSING VEHICLE TO EXPERIENCE NO REVERSE / NO FIRST GEAR.   *YC
WHEN DRIVING AT ANY SPEED THE VEHICLE IS STALLING AND  SHIFTING HARD.  ALSO, THERE IS A KNOCKING NOISE COMING FROM THE VEHICLE.  *AK
TRANSMISSION HAS BEEN REPLACED A TOTAL OF SIX TIMES. MJS

ON TWO OCCASIONS CONSUMER NOTICED SMOKE COMING FROM THE STEERING COLUMN. VEHICLE WAS INSPECTED BY INDEPENDENT REPAIR SHOP AND WAS  INFORMED THAT A  PINCHED WIRE MIGHT HAVE  CAUSED  THE SHORT THAT RESULTED IN A FIRE. CONSUMER BELIEVED THIS PROBLEM SHOULD BE CORRECTED BY MANUFACTURER AT NO COST TO CONSUMER. CAN NHTSA HELP IN THIS MATTER. *AK
THE FUEL INJECTORS HAVE LEAKED 3 TIMES. DEALER REPLACED FUEL INJECTORS EACH TIME.  *AK
VEHICLE EXPERIENCED A TIRE BLOWOUT EIGHT DAYS AFTER PURCHASE, TIRE MAY HAVE BEEN DEFECTIVE.  *YC

WHEN SHIFTING FROM 1ST GEAR TO 2ND, TRANSMISSION WILL SHIFT INTO NEUTRAL.  RESTARTING ENGINE WILL ALLOW VEHICLE TO DRIVE IN FIRST ONLY.  ATTEMPTS BY VEHICLE TO SHIFT INTO SECOND WILL THROW TRANSMISSION IN TO NEUTRAL.  HOWEVER, IF THE VEHICLE IS ALLOWED TO SIT FOR 1/2 TO 2 HOURS, THEN TRANSMISSION OPERATES NORMALLY.  PROBLEM CAN OCCUR AFTER DRIVING FOR 1/2 HOUR OR MORE AND/OR IN STOP AND GO TRAFFIC.  I HEAR THAT THIS OR VERY SIMILAR PROBLEMS HAVE OCCURRED TO MANY OTHER DODGE CARAVAN OWNERS.  DO YOU HAVE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION? *AK

WHILE OWNER WAS SHUTTING THE SLIDING DOOR ,  DOOR CAME OFF THE TRACK AND FELL OFF ONTO THE GROUND. THE DEALER IS AWARE OF THE PROBLEM. THE PROBLEM HAS NOT BEEN CORRECTED.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER DETAILS.  *AK

DEFECTIVE FUEL LINE, CAUSING A  LEAK.  IF THERE WAS A SOURCE OF IGNITION A FIRE MAY HAVE STARTED.  MANUFACTURER IS FULLY AWARE OF THE PROBLEM, AND PARTS HAVE BEEN ON  BACK ORDER  FOR MONTHS.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.  *AK

THE SHIFTER IS VERY HARD TO PUT INTO GEAR. THE SHIFTER LOCKS IN WHATEVER GEAR IT IS SET IN. AFTER SEVERAL MINUTES IT RELEASES. THE DEALER IS NOT ABLE TO DUPLICATE WHAT THE  PROBLEM IS  AT THIS TIME.  *AK
BRAKING SYSTEM MALFUNCTIONED,  CAUSING EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE WHICH MAY HAVE RESULTED IN  AN ACCIDENT.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.  *AK
FUEL RAIL FAILED RESULTING IN LEAKAGE.

THE CONSUMER HAS BEEN EXPERIENCING PROBLEMS WITH THE AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION. TRANSMISSION HAS LOCKED UP IN LOW GEAR.  CONSUMER HAD PREVIOUSLY REPLACED  TRANSMISSION TWICE.  MANUFACTURER HAS BEEN CONTACTED.
NO SUMMARY
TRANSMISSION IS MAKING LOUD NOISE. ALSO, VEHICLE  LURCHES FOWARD WHICH COULD CAUSE AN ACCIDENT.  *AK *ML
INDICATOR LEVEL NOT SHOWN IN PROPER POSITION WHENEVER GEARS ARE SHIF. CONSUMER ALSO INDICATED THAT WHEN HE TIGTHENS THE CABLE LINE THE CABLE WOULD LOOSEN, AND CAUSES THE PROBLEM TO REOCCUR.  *AK

summary: WHEN DRIVING AT ANY SPEED THE VEHICLE WILL CUT OFF, LEAVEING THE CONSUMER IN THE MIDDLE OF TRAFFIC. ENGINE  CHECK LIGHT  CAME ON, AND THE LIGHT WILL STAY ON.  CONSUMER HAD TO WAIT FIVE MINUTES AND START THE VEHICLE BACK UP. THE VEHICLE WILL DRIVE FOR ABOUT ONE MINUTES AND CUT BACK OFF, AND THE CONSUMER TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE SHOP FOUR TIMES, AND THEY CAN'T DETERMINE THE PROBLEM.   *AK
CONSUMER WAS IN A REAR AND FRONT END ACCIDENT, THE DRIVER'S RESTRAINT BELT DID NOT RESTRAIN PROPERLY, CONSUMER HIT HEAD ON THE ROOF OF THE VEHICLE. DEALER HAS BEEN CONTACTED.   *AK
BRAKES HAVE FAILED SEVERAL TIMES CAUSING SEVERAL COLLISIONS.

PUMP BUSHING DISINTEGRATED. THIS CAUSED THE TORQUE CONVERTOR TO BE DAMAGED. TRANSMISSION FLUID LEAKED. WAS PULLING AWAY FROM STATION WHEN A WHINING NOISE WAS HEARD. TRANSMISSION WAS REPLACED AUGUST 1995.  *AK

CONSUMER EXPERIENCED FOUR TRANSMISSION REPLACMENTS, AND HAD TWO OF THEM REBUILT.  HOWEVER, IS STILL EXPERIENCING PROBLEM WITH VEHICLE SLIPPING/JERKING INTO GEAR, AND TRANSMISSION STALLING WHEN TAKING OFF FROM A STOP POSITION.  *AK

TRANSMISSION FAILURE.  APPARENTLY THIS IS A KNOWN PROBLEM WITH THE MAKE AND YEAR.

RECALL # 89V237000 ,  VEHICLE NOT INCLUDED. THE ENGINE VALVE COVER GASKET HAS DISLOCATED, CAUSING AN OIL LEAK ONTO THE EXHAUST MANIFOLD. COULD RESULT IN A   POSSIBLE FIRE. WHEN MAKING A RIGHT OR LEFT HAND TURNS THE VEHICLE SPUTTERS THEN LURCHES FORWARD.  TAKEN TO THE DEALER, AND IT WAS THE TRANSMISSION.  THIS IS THE 2ND TRANSMISSION PUT INTO THE VEHICLE AND THE PROBLEM IS STILL OCCURRING.  *AK

VALVE GUIDES IN THE ENGINE SLIP LOOSE, CAUSING OIL TO BURN VISIBLE AT THE EXHAUST PIPE.

VERY THIN METAL/THINLY PLATED CLAMPS THAT HOLD THE RUBBER TUBES  TO THE FUEL FILLER UNDERNEATH THE FLOOR PAN RUSTED THROUGH, CAUSING A FUEL LEAK, WHICH IF IGNITED BY A SOURCE, MAY CAUSE A FIRE.   *AK

WHILE DRIVING THE FRONT END COLLASPED, CAUSING THE LEFT FRONT AXLE TO BREAK. THIS HAS HAPPENED 3 TIMES IN 2 YEARS.  *AK

BRAKE CYLINDERS LOCKING UP CAUSING DAMAGE TO OTHER BRAKE COMPONENTS AND LOSS OF CONTROL.
ONCE AGAIN BRAKE FAILED, UNABLE TO STOP VEHICLE AS NEEDED, BRAKES ARE SPONGEY AND UNRELIABLE AND HAVE BEEN FIXED A NUMBER OF TIMES.
